info.title: FriendlyScore Public API
info.description: Public API for communication with FriendlyScore

get.summary: Returns the list of users. Can be used for seeking users.

parameters.name: by-user-reference
parameters.description: Filter by user identifier from **your** database

post.summary: Post bank account collection for given customer.

get.summary: Get bank account list for a given customer.

200.description: Returns a collection of bank accounts

post.summary: Post bank balance collection for given customer and bank. This is an asynchronous endpoint.
Post bank transaction collection for given customer and bank. This is an asynchronous endpoint.
post.description: Transactions that have already been posted before will be skipped.

get.summary: Get bank balance list for a given customer.

200.description: Returns a collection of bank balances

get.summary: Get customer's connected banks with embedded consent objects.

200.description: Returns customer's banks with embedded consent objects

404.description: Returns 404 when customer is not found

get.summary: Get the current user consent for given bank

parameters.name: consent_type
parameters.description: Identifier of the consent type. Currently only `'account'` is used.

parameters.name: bank_slug
parameters.description: Identifier of the bank. Bank slug

404.description: Returns not found when there is no consent

patch.summary: Update given set of transactions with a new category.

parameters.name: category_patch
parameters.description: Object describing which transactions should be patched and what category should be set.

204.description: Transaction categories have been updated successfully

get.summary: Get bank transaction list for a given customer.

parameters.name: max_per_page
parameters.description: Item count on one page (1000 by default)

parameters.name: booking_date_time_from
parameters.description: Min value (inclusive) for booking date time filter (UNIX timestamp in seconds)

parameters.name: booking_date_time_to
parameters.description: Max value (inclusive) for booking date time filter (UNIX timestamp in seconds)

200.description: Returns a collection of bank transactions

400.description: JSON with validation errors (query filters are validated and check for illegal values)

200.description: Returns an array of available banks

get.summary: Get the the forecasts for customer

parameters.name: forecast_id
parameters.description: ID of the forecast. Should be `current_personal` or `current_business`. `current` is now deprecated (works as `current_personal`).

get.summary: Get the insights for customer's personal accounts

200.description: Returns an `Insights` object for customer's personal accounts

get.summary: Get the insights for customer's business accounts

200.description: Returns an `Insights` object for customer's business accounts

400.description: JSON with validation errors e.g. missing required fields
JSON with validation errors e.g. missing required fields

get.summary: Get the current status of a certain data processing request.
Get the current status of a all data processing requests for current user.

200.description: Returns a collection of `DtnDataProcessingSummary` (all for current authenticated user)

get.summary: Get the current readiness status for a certain report.
Get the current readiness status for all reports for current user.

200.description: Returns a collection of `ReportReadinessStatus` (all for current authenticated user)

id.title: User ID used across the API
id.description: User ID used across the API

customer_ip.description: Customer's IP address for analysis (if available)

updated_at.title: Date and time of last status change.
updated_at.description: Date and time of last status change.

processing_status.title: Processing status of the posted piece of data
processing_status.description: Processing status of the posted piece of data

dtn_slug.title: Slug of the relevant data process or DTN (useful in URLs)
dtn_slug.description: Slug of the relevant data process or DTN (useful in URLs)

consent_id.title: Unique identification as assigned to identify the account access consent resource.
consent_id.description: Unique identification as assigned to identify the account access consent resource.

creation_date_time.title: Date and time at which the resource was created. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in UNIX timestamp format.
creation_date_time.description: Date and time at which the resource was created. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in UNIX timestamp format.

status.title: Consent status, one of: Rejected, AwaitingAuthorisation, Authorised, Revoked.
status.description: Consent status, one of: Rejected, AwaitingAuthorisation, Authorised, Revoked.

status_update_date_time.title: Date and time at which the resource status was updated. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in UNIX timestamp format.
status_update_date_time.description: Date and time at which the resource status was updated. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in UNIX timestamp format.

expiration_date_time.title: Specified date and time the permissions will expire. If this is not populated, the permissions will be open ended. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in UNIX timestamp format.
expiration_date_time.description: Specified date and time the permissions will expire. If this is not populated, the permissions will be open ended. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in UNIX timestamp format.

transaction_from_date_time.title: Specified start date and time for the transaction query period. If this is not populated, the start date will be open ended, and data will be returned from the earliest available transaction. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in UNIX timestamp format.
transaction_from_date_time.description: Specified start date and time for the transaction query period. If this is not populated, the start date will be open ended, and data will be returned from the earliest available transaction. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in UNIX timestamp format.

transaction_to_date_time.title: Specified end date and time for the transaction query period. If this is not populated, the end date will be open ended, and data will be returned to the latest available transaction. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in UNIX timestamp format.
transaction_to_date_time.description: Specified end date and time for the transaction query period. If this is not populated, the end date will be open ended, and data will be returned to the latest available transaction. All dates in the JSON payloads are represented in UNIX timestamp format.

category_changes.title: An array of transaction lists for different categories
category_changes.description: An array of transaction lists for different categories

income_expenditure.title: Info if this category applies to income or expenditure
income_expenditure.description: Info if this category applies to income or expenditure

liquidity.title: Multiple liquidity scores for various timespans
liquidity.description: Multiple liquidity scores for various timespans

send_email.description: Set if you want FriendlyScore to send email with invitation

name.title: Name of the referred report (current allowed values are: forecast|insights)
name.description: Name of the referred report (current allowed values are: forecast|insights)

status.title: Readiness status for the given report
status.description: Readiness status for the given report

account_types.title: List of available reports by bank account type ("Business", "Personal")
account_types.description: List of available reports by bank account type ("Business", "Personal")

amount.title: Amount of associated currency (positive for income and negative for expenditure)
amount.description: Amount of associated currency (positive for income and negative for expenditure)

external_transaction_id.title: Transaction ID from the original data source. Must be unique for associated user and account.
external_transaction_id.description: Transaction ID from the original data source. Must be unique for associated user and account.

amount.description: Amount of associated currency (positive for income and negative for expenditure)

is_active.description: Denotes if this bank can currently be used.

country_code.title: ISO ALPHA2 code of the assigned country
country_code.description: ISO ALPHA2 code of the assigned country

is_working.title: Denotes if this bank's API is responding at the moment.
is_working.description: Denotes if this bank's API is responding at the moment.

is_api_only.description: Denotes if this bank is available only via the API (no Connect availability)
